block.p: Nancy Jean Byrne, the executive director of the New Jersey Office of Travel and Tourism, was married yesterday to Peter Sargent Reinhart, a home-building executive. Edward J. McKenna Jr., the mayor of Red Bank, N.J., officiated at the Molly Pitcher Inn there, and Justice James R. Zazzali of the New Jersey Supreme Court participated in the ceremony.

Nancy Jean Byrne, the executive director of the New Jersey Office of Travel and Tourism, was married yesterday to Peter Sargent Reinhart, a home-building executive. Edward J. McKenna Jr., the mayor of Red Bank, N.J., officiated at the Molly Pitcher Inn there, and Justice James R. Zazzali of the New Jersey Supreme Court participated in the ceremony.

Nancy Jean Byrne, the executive director of the New Jersey Office of Travel and Tourism, was married yesterday to Peter Sargent Reinhart, a home-building executive. Edward J. McKenna Jr., the mayor of Red Bank, N.J., officiated at the Molly Pitcher Inn there, and Justice James R. Zazzali of the New Jersey Supreme Court participated in the ceremony.

She is a daughter of Jean F. Byrne of Princeton, N.J., and Brendan T. Byrne of Short Hills, N.J. Her father, who was the governor of New Jersey from 1974 to 1982, is a partner in Carella, Byrne, Bain, Gilfillan, Cecchi, Stewart & Olstein, a law firm in Roseland, N.J. The bride is a stepdaughter of Ruthi Zinn Byrne.

Mr. Reinhart, 56, is a senior vice president and the general counsel at Hovnanian Enterprises, the home builder in Red Bank. He graduated from Franklin & Marshall College and received a law degree with honors from Rutgers School of Law at Camden. He is on the board of the Meridian Hospitals, four nonprofit New Jersey hospitals.
He is a son of Martha S. Reinhart and Charles W. Reinhart of Sun Lakes, Ariz. His father, who is retired, was a vice president and account supervisor at Creamer, a New York advertising agency.
The bridegroom's three previous marriages ended in divorce.
